mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Thomas Rossiter to Benson J. Lossing, 1859 January 22
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Rossiter, Thomas Prichard, 1818-1871
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Artist Thomas P. Rossiter writes to Benson Lossing to inquire who was living at Mount Vernon in 1784 when Lafayette visited. "In conjunction with M. Mignot, I have commenced a composition of Washington, Lafayette and 4 or 5 members of the Mt. Vernon family on the piazza but with all my investigation am at a loss to learn who were the members of the household during Lafayette's first visit in August 1784." Autograph letter signed, 3 pages. Rossiter and Mignot's painting was completed in 1859 and is currently in the collection at The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York.
